byline.contributor: Jesse McKinley reported from Plattsburgh, and Benjamin Mueller from New York.
byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and BENJAMIN MUELLER

abstract: Former Clinton Correctional Facility employee Joyce E Mitchell pleads guilty to felony and misdemeanor charges for helping convicts Richard W Matt and David Sweat break out of prison; will cooperate with ongoing investigation of widespread abuses and security lapses in prison system, pay $6,000 fine and be sentenced to between two and one-third years to seven years under terms of plea agreement
lead_paragraph: Ms. Mitchell was charged with providing the tools, including hacksaw blades and chisels, that two inmates used to break out of Clinton Correctional Facility in Dannemora, N.Y., in June.

headline.main: Joyce Mitchell, Ex-New York Prison Worker, Pleads Guilty to Aiding Killers’ Escape
headline.print_headline: Ex-Prison Worker Pleads Guilty in Breakout; Faces Sentence of Up to 7 Years

snippet: Ms. Mitchell was charged with providing the tools, including hacksaw blades and chisels, that two inmates used to break out of Clinton Correctional Facility in Dannemora, N.Y., in June.
